main event: A 200-pound, unidentified cylindrical object, 18 to 24 inches in diameter and 6 to 7 feet long, painted red and white, dropped by parachute in a remote section northwest of North Vernon, Indiana on May 8, 1963.
interesting points: The object had devices that appeared to be meters, but there was no numbering or lettering to give a clue to its identity.
The Air Force and State Police recovered the object and planned to move it to Bunker Hill Air Force Base for further study.
The sighting was reported to be a practical non-standard aircraft or possibly a balloon.
The document mentions testing parachute testing and animal launching, indicating the object may have been part of an experimental program.
The incident was documented in a Project Blue Book record card, suggesting it was part of the US government's historical investigations into unidentified flying objects.
sighted object: Cylindrical object, 18-24 inches in diameter and 6-7 feet long, painted red and white
